text.p: Spanish government bonds dropped suddenly in thin trade at Friday's close, as a weaker peseta and jitters ahead of this weekend's European finance ministers' meeting kicked in, dealers said.
"The peseta suddenly got weaker, along with other peripherals, and that made bonds a bit nervous," said a trader.
The 10-year cash spread versus the benchmark Bund widened to 83 basis points from 73 basis in early trade.
The shift lower was a typical precautionary movement ahead of an EU meeting which may or may not help dispel doubts overhanging European monetary union, dealers said.
